content:
github-actions[bot] commented on issue #6520:

Subscribe to Label Action

cc @fitzgen

<details>

  • fitzgen: fuzzing

To subscribe or unsubscribe from this label, edit the <code>.github/subscribe-to-label.json</code> configuration file.

Learn more.

afonso360 commented on issue #6520:

How do the timeouts work? Does the interpreter count instructions executed, and the native execution doesn't, and that's why you don't expect timeouts from native execution? Assuming that's true, this seems great.

Yes, exactly. Actually the native execution only ever returns RunResult::Success, there's nothing else it can do. Timeout is there mostly to prevent infinite loops.

afonso360 edited a comment on issue #6520:

How do the timeouts work? Does the interpreter count instructions executed, and the native execution doesn't, and that's why you don't expect timeouts from native execution? Assuming that's true, this seems great.

Yes, exactly. Actually the native execution only ever returns RunResult::Success, there's nothing else it can do (it can also segfault). Timeout is there mostly to prevent infinite loops.
